in a way that is not fair or equal: be inequitably distributed They complained that the money had been inequitably distributed among the team members. We were concerned that healthcare was being provided inequitably so as to benefit the rich.
More examplesFewer examplesIn our society, wealth is very inequitably distributed.She argued forcefully that women are inequitably compensated for the contribution they make to society.The report said that the scheme allocated resources inefficiently and inequitably.People who feel that they have been inequitably treated are entitled to register a complaint.
